newsitem.title: USA: Chubb to name Kelso new CFO.
newsitem.headline: Chubb to name Kelso new CFO.

text.p: Chubb Corp said it plans to name executive vice president David Kelso to the post of chief financial officer.
In a conference call with analysts on Thursday afternoon, Chubb chief executive Dean O'Hare said Kelso will replace Percy Chubb III, who was scheduled to retire February 1, 1997.
A replay of the conference call was later made available.
The official announcement was scheduled for October 31.
Kelso was elected executive vice president of the Chubb Corp and Chubb & Son Inc in July and has shared responsibilities for worldwide financial activities with Percy Chubb.
Prior to joining Chubb in July 1996, Kelso was executive vice president of First Commerce Corp in New Orleans, where he also served as chief financial officer.
